tags: I guess it would be that tag????
summary: there’s this one particular scene with Mollymauk from ep14 that i’ve been reflecting on due to recent events (EPISODE 49...
body:
there’s this one particular scene with Mollymauk from ep14 that i’ve been reflecting on due to recent events (EPISODE 49 SPOILERS UNDER THE CUT) but here take this as i cry abt my fUCKING BOY:

Caleb was watching Mollymauk very carefully.

The purple tiefling was sitting, tattooed and scarred arms crossed, glaring at Nott. The magic was compelling his lips to loosen and spill the truth of his past, or apparent lack thereof. Caleb had kept his own mouth shut, for the most part, but now he leaned forward, watching Molly’s red eyes flash at the notion of being called “Lucien”.

“Let me make this abundantly clear: My name is Molly. That person is dead, and not me. It’s just a person who had this body. They abandoned it.” And then, in a quick flourish of conviction, jutting his thumbs out at himself, “It’s mine now.”

As Nott and Molly began antagonizing one another again, there was a profound, familiar ache in Caleb’s chest, one that he knew none of the people around him would realize. What an odd parallel to have with this bright circus man, he thought, flames licking at the base of his thoughts, for a name, or a body, to be yours, but also a ghost’s.

Caleb could feel the strange divine magics around him begin to fade, and thus felt safe interjecting, “Perhaps we have learned all we need to learn from this conversation. Maybe it is time to turn in. We have some things to do tomorrow. I am satisfied, Mollymauk Tealeaf.” A short, silent beat, eyes locking with Mollymauk’s, “For now.”

Molly held his gaze for a moment. “This was not how I expected this to go. Thank you.” The spell dissipated around them, and Caleb dropped his eyes first, gaze falling to the ground. Eye contact was always uncomfortable, but with Mollymauk in particular; something about those flat, crimson eyes could see past the dirt and the dust, right into his intentionally obfuscated soul. Caleb knew what it was like to leave behind a name, an identity, and never want to touch it again, and some part of him feared Mollymauk would realize this specific and damning empathy.

The conversation shifted, into their job for the Gentleman, into something Caleb didn’t bother listening to. He was thinking of names, of Lucien and Molly, of Caleb and Bren.

Bren was a name that burned when he held it. It was an impossible feeling, to simultaneously know that Bren was himself and yet another person entirely. All the good he could connect to the name– the lullabies his mother sang to him, the pride in his father’s voice– it all went down in flames with the awful. It got mixed up with and tainted by Trent’s beratings and role-calling, his name being shouted as he messed up complicated spells, as he cried and collapsed in front of his burning home. And now he was here, he was Caleb.

So, in a way, Bren was his Lucien. There were people out there searching for Bren, but they would find Caleb in his stead. It wasn’t an exact parallel, of course. Some small, selfish part of Caleb envied Mollymauk’s amnesia; that part of him would have given anything to forget Bren and everything attached to that name. Unlike Molly, Caleb was well aware of every horrible thing his past self had reveled in.

Caleb stared down at his hands, the brown gloves perpetually singed and covering the calloused, ugly things beneath them. My name is Caleb, his thoughts echoed, allowing himself to replicate the confidence of Mollymauk for a moment, that person is dead and not me. It’s just a person who had this body. They abandoned it. It’s mine now.

It was a nice thought, but he knew that Bren would never abandon him in the way that Lucien abandoned Mollymauk. And he, Caleb, would always be responsible and guilty for Bren’s atrocities. Bren was wholly unforgivable and so was he.

Nott nudged his leg, and Caleb jumped slightly, his startled gaze matching her yellow, earnest one.

“You alright?” Her eyes were less piercing than Mollymauk’s, but nonetheless unnerving in the face of his guilt. Caleb glanced off to the side, at the wall, at nothing.

“Ja,” he breathed, turning his eyes towards the table, “Are you ready to go upstairs now?” He noticed the conversation amongst his compatriots had stilled, as they gathered up their things and talked low amongst themselves. Mollymauk was looking at him, and Caleb stood quickly from his seat, ready to disappear into his room.

She cast him a sidelong glance as he stood. “Yes,” She said, hesitant, “Are you sure you’re alright, Caleb?” Caleb didn’t reply, and tried not to seem hurried as he rushed to the stairs.

He felt Mollymauk’s gaze burning into his back the entire way up to his room.
body_abstract:
there’s this one particular scene with Mollymauk from ep14 that i’ve been reflecting on due to recent events (EPISODE 49 SPOILERS UNDER THE CUT) but here take this as i cry abt my fUCKING BOY:

Caleb was watching Mollymauk very carefully.

The purple tiefling was sitting, tattooed and scarred arms crossed, glaring at Nott. The magic was compelling his lips to loosen and spill the truth of his past, or apparent lack thereof. Caleb had kept his own mouth shut, for the most part, but now he leaned forward, watching Molly’s red eyes flash at the notion of being called “Lucien”.

“You alright?” Her eyes were less piercing than Mollymauk’s, but nonetheless unnerving in the face of his guilt. Caleb glanced off to the side, at the wall, at nothing.

“Ja,” he breathed, turning his eyes towards the table, “Are you ready to go upstairs now?” He noticed the conversation amongst his compatriots had stilled, as they gathered up their things and talked low amongst themselves. Mollymauk was looking at him, and Caleb stood quickly from his seat, ready to disappear into his room.

She cast him a sidelong glance as he stood. “Yes,” She said, hesitant, “Are you sure you’re alright, Caleb?” Caleb didn’t reply, and tried not to seem hurried as he rushed to the stairs.

He felt Mollymauk’s gaze burning into his back the entire way up to his room.

tags: guess it's just......one of those days
every time i think i'm over him my brain pulls out shit like this and i'm back where i started
summary: currently thinking about how molly’s biggest fear was being alone and now he’s  rotting in the ground in the middle of nowhere ...
body:
currently thinking about how molly’s biggest fear was being alone and now he’s 

  1. rotting in the ground in the middle of nowhere
  2. alone in the afterlife because all the friends he made in his wacky two years are still alive and kicking

summary: Because I’ve read spoilers that I shouldn’t have but which are REALLY HARD TO AVOID, I’m listening to this cute, sweet little...
body: Because I’ve read spoilers that I shouldn’t have but which are REALLY HARD TO AVOID, I’m listening to this cute, sweet little episode of Nott and the Mighty Nein at the bath house and it’s breaking my fucking heart.

blog.name: kimabutch
blog.title: Revolutionary
blog.description: I'm Charlie! I'm attempting to tag "cr spoilers" until the subsequent Tuesday, but don't expect perfection. I'm into a lot of things — right now it's mostly Critical Role, but Utena still owns my heart. 22, butch lesbian, she/her. Link to asks!

tags: THIS GOT SO LONG I'M SORRY
the lack of episode this week makes me grab onto any new stuff
summary: Some thoughts from Matt’s DM notes: 1. I was already scared of Trent, but I’m somehow even more terrified now.  His skin is...
body:
Some thoughts from Matt’s DM notes:

1. I was already scared of Trent, but I’m somehow even more terrified now. 

His skin is somewhat jaundiced with visible liverspots. His thin lips hold a perpetual grin that reads both scheming and amused. He wears a dark grey cloak hiding robes of white and gold… the flying mage from the Gala assault. (Master Trent Ikithon) […] The cloaked mage looks to the party and nods with a wide, somewhat wicked smile, inspecting each of you like a shopping chef might inspect produce in a stall.

What the fuck, Matt. 

2. I think the above passage confirms that Caleb’s necklace prevents recognition from Trent even when Caleb’s right in front of him. That, or that Trent recognizes Caleb, but doesn’t care. Or maybe Matt just eliminated the notes that describe the possibility of Trent recognizing Caleb. I think the latter is less likely, though, because I doubt Matt would create a scenario where Trent would confront Caleb so early on. 

3. Oremid Hass is a very interesting character. I don’t trust him at all given that he works for the Empire, but Pumat does describe of him as a “softie” and he was very nice to Frumpkin. And now there’s this:

“I see you bring goblinkin amongst the peoples of Zadash. You call these peoples your companions, little green one? This warms me. While sometimes informed by our nature, I strongly believe we are largely a product of our bonds and our environment. I’ve seen beastmen as far as Tal’Dorei live among the townships in peace. In time, even giants and snakemen might aid one another openly. Besides… the further we can civilize the more volatile races, the less power the Xhorhasian hoards have.”

So he’s a bit of a… “benevolent” racist? This fits well with the picture of him that we already have. Someone who truly believes they’re working for the “greater good” and doing what’s right, and who’s significantly nicer than Trent… but still dangerous, still racist, still colonial in attitude. 

4. Count me as genuinely surprised that the letter would actually have allowed Fjord to get into the Soltryce Academy. I thought for sure they’d laugh him out, particularly because he’s a half-orc. I’m pretty terrified at the thought that that could have happened.

5. I’m very glad to know more about the Tombtakers. Also glad to hear more about the Myriad, who are apparently active in Rexxentrum (one of Lucien’s former companions is now a “torturer for the Myriad in Rexxentrum.”

6. “If the Gentleman ever feels he is being lied to, it sends him into a furious rage” and they have to fucking fight him. Now I’m thinking back to all the times they’ve lied to the Gentleman and shivering.

7. The Gentleman has a contact out in Felderwin: “Draconian survivor with an anger problem. Likes slaves who can work hard but also can take a beating.” 

I wonder if he’s still there and there’s a possibility of the M9 running into him. I don’t think they’d like him very much. Also! I think this is the first we’ve heard of “Draconian survivors”? I want to know more about Draconia, Matt! Did they make any sort of peace with the Ravenites? Did they manage to get the floaty things back up? TELL US.

8. The plot would have been SO different if they’d escaped with Cree and she’d taken them to Shadycreek Run. I don’t think Molly would have been down for it, but if he had — instant Molly backstory arc (which would have been the second time that Taliesin’s character arc came first!) 

9. Holy shit, Matt really does come up with names for all the minor NPCs in advance. 

10. Interesting insight into where Matt stops prepping — he doesn’t include any notes for the post-Victory Pit party, so he must have planned to stop after the fight. I always wonder how he figures out where to stop, not knowing what the players are going to do.

6. “If the Gentleman ever feels he is being lied to, it sends him into a furious rage” and they have to fucking fight him. Now I’m thinking back to all the times they’ve lied to the Gentleman and shivering.

7. The Gentleman has a contact out in Felderwin: “Draconian survivor with an anger problem. Likes slaves who can work hard but also can take a beating.” 

I wonder if he’s still there and there’s a possibility of the M9 running into him. I don’t think they’d like him very much. Also! I think this is the first we’ve heard of “Draconian survivors”? I want to know more about Draconia, Matt! Did they make any sort of peace with the Ravenites? Did they manage to get the floaty things back up? TELL US.

8. The plot would have been SO different if they’d escaped with Cree and she’d taken them to Shadycreek Run. I don’t think Molly would have been down for it, but if he had — instant Molly backstory arc (which would have been the second time that Taliesin’s character arc came first!) 

9. Holy shit, Matt really does come up with names for all the minor NPCs in advance. 

10. Interesting insight into where Matt stops prepping — he doesn’t include any notes for the post-Victory Pit party, so he must have planned to stop after the fight. I always wonder how he figures out where to stop, not knowing what the players are going to do.

trail.content_raw:
Some thoughts from Matt’s DM notes:

1. I was already scared of Trent, but I’m somehow even more terrified now. 

His skin is somewhat jaundiced with visible liverspots. His thin lips hold a perpetual grin that reads both scheming and amused. He wears a dark grey cloak hiding robes of white and gold… the flying mage from the Gala assault. (Master Trent Ikithon) […] The cloaked mage looks to the party and nods with a wide, somewhat wicked smile, inspecting each of you like a shopping chef might inspect produce in a stall.

What the fuck, Matt. 

2. I think the above passage confirms that Caleb’s necklace prevents recognition from Trent even when Caleb’s right in front of him. That, or that Trent recognizes Caleb, but doesn’t care. Or maybe Matt just eliminated the notes that describe the possibility of Trent recognizing Caleb. I think the latter is less likely, though, because I doubt Matt would create a scenario where Trent would confront Caleb so early on. 

3. Oremid Hass is a very interesting character. I don’t trust him at all given that he works for the Empire, but Pumat does describe of him as a “softie” and he was very nice to Frumpkin. And now there’s this:

“I see you bring goblinkin amongst the peoples of Zadash. You call these peoples your companions, little green one? This warms me. While sometimes informed by our nature, I strongly believe we are largely a product of our bonds and our environment. I’ve seen beastmen as far as Tal’Dorei live among the townships in peace. In time, even giants and snakemen might aid one another openly. Besides… the further we can civilize the more volatile races, the less power the Xhorhasian hoards have.”

So he’s a bit of a… “benevolent” racist? This fits well with the picture of him that we already have. Someone who truly believes they’re working for the “greater good” and doing what’s right, and who’s significantly nicer than Trent… but still dangerous, still racist, still colonial in attitude. 

4. Count me as genuinely surprised that the letter would actually have allowed Fjord to get into the Soltryce Academy. I thought for sure they’d laugh him out, particularly because he’s a half-orc. I’m pretty terrified at the thought that that could have happened.

5. I’m very glad to know more about the Tombtakers. Also glad to hear more about the Myriad, who are apparently active in Rexxentrum (one of Lucien’s former companions is now a “torturer for the Myriad in Rexxentrum.”

6. “If the Gentleman ever feels he is being lied to, it sends him into a furious rage” and they have to fucking fight him. Now I’m thinking back to all the times they’ve lied to the Gentleman and shivering.

7. The Gentleman has a contact out in Felderwin: “Draconian survivor with an anger problem. Likes slaves who can work hard but also can take a beating.” 

I wonder if he’s still there and there’s a possibility of the M9 running into him. I don’t think they’d like him very much. Also! I think this is the first we’ve heard of “Draconian survivors”? I want to know more about Draconia, Matt! Did they make any sort of peace with the Ravenites? Did they manage to get the floaty things back up? TELL US.

8. The plot would have been SO different if they’d escaped with Cree and she’d taken them to Shadycreek Run. I don’t think Molly would have been down for it, but if he had — instant Molly backstory arc (which would have been the second time that Taliesin’s character arc came first!) 

9. Holy shit, Matt really does come up with names for all the minor NPCs in advance. 

10. Interesting insight into where Matt stops prepping — he doesn’t include any notes for the post-Victory Pit party, so he must have planned to stop after the fight. I always wonder how he figures out where to stop, not knowing what the players are going to do.

blog.name: dndcharacterideas
blog.title: D&D Character Ideas
blog.description:
This blog has been created so I would have a place to put my ideas for D&D characters and maybe the story of a few characters I've played in the past. 

If you have a concept, story, dungeon map or just an image that you've made and would like to share, by all means feel free to submit it.

title: Critical Role Spoilers
body: As per Matt’s Episode 17 notes, it’s confirmed that the gentleman dealt in slaves. How fucked up is it that Jester’s dad is a slave trafficker…. Jester, who’s been captured and tortured with the intent to be sold into slavery, has a dad who fucking makes money subjecting people to the same shit… It’s so fucked up.

blog.name: nilim
blog.title: The sky may be falling, but the stars look good on you
blog.description:
D&D, Critical Role, Discworld. 
-
I create meta, gifsets, fanart and fanfiction.

My inbox is always open for prompts, and I love getting them... but no guarantees.

summary: If they screw up with the gentlemen their completely fucked now right? With Jester questioning if he’s her father he may just...
question: If they screw up with the gentlemen their completely fucked now right? With Jester questioning if he’s her father he may just cut that loose end and without Molly why would Cree help,,,?
answer:
So, I feel like as a DM you always try to utilize character bonds and characters’ backgrounds as potential interesting ‘outs’ in dangerous situations. You never/rarely want to set up your party for a ‘one wrong move and you’re all dead’ situation. Every potential dangerous situation usually has contingency plans, especially ones that rely heavily on diplomacy instead of just straight up fighting.

I think it’s pretty obvious Matt works this way as well, evident from years of watching him DM, but also the DM notes he just posted. He plans for contingencies even in situations that might normally seem like a TPK, for example after which characters might simply get knocked unconscious and wake up as prisoners.

Yes, in the notes currently it appears Cree would have been their only out if they lost during a Gentleman confrontation. However, now that Molly is out of the picture, I don’t think it’s as simple as ‘Well, this means they’re fucked if they ever decide to screw with the Gentleman’. As a DM, you would come up with new options, because otherwise it’s unfair to put the party in a potential no-win scenario down the line.

Personally, I feel like Jester’s whole history with the Gentleman is a huge opportunity, so I would find it quite boring for both the players and for the story if it turned out the Gentleman would want to murder her just to tie up loose ends. I think exploiting that relationship to the benefit for the party would also allow Matt to show a different side to the Gentleman, where we would be able to see him struggle with what’s best for him/his business vs. the emotional attachment he might have to the Ruby/Jester. This would lead to a way more interesting story, and would give the party a new way out of potentially unwinnable scenario, if one should ever arise.

I think it’s pretty obvious Matt works this way as well, evident from years of watching him DM, but also the DM notes he just posted. He plans for contingencies even in situations that might normally seem like a TPK, for example after which characters might simply get knocked unconscious and wake up as prisoners.

This would lead to a way more interesting story, and would give the party a new way out of potentially unwinnable scenario, if one should ever arise.

blog.name: night-filled-mountain
blog.description:
“Each atom of that stone, each mineral flake of that night-filled mountain, in itself forms a world. The struggle itself toward the heights is enough to fill a man's heart. One must imagine Sisyphus happy.”

-Albert Camus, “The Myth of Sisyphus”

tags: i've always been kind of sad that i couldn't watch after dark
but it's so much fun to marathon these retrospectively
summary: On the After Dark for c2e10, “Waste and Webs,” Brian asks Liam and Taliesin whether they would sacrifice a member of the Mighty...
body:
On the After Dark for c2e10, “Waste and Webs,” Brian asks Liam and Taliesin whether they would sacrifice a member of the Mighty Nein to get out of a bad situation–and if so, which one.

Both of them, emphatically: “Nott!”

Brian: “Whoa!”

Liam: “Kidding! Molly. Totally Molly.”

…Forty episodes later, guess which M9 members have canonically died, you monsters!? 😛
